content:
Hi everyone! I am brand new to Lean and am interested in contributing to mathlib.
I would be most interested in helping with analysis, probability theory, and linear algebra.
What's a good way to get started with this? Should I just pick some of the topics from https://leanprover-community.github.io/undergrad_todo.html and start working on them?

I'd say ask the community if anyone is working on what you're aiming at beforehand to avoid duplicate effort. And if you're comfortable enough with Lean then I think you'll be fine?
Welcome :D
@Tony Wang welcome! Here's a curated sublist of that undergrad list: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/wiki/Undergrad-TODO-trivial-targets
